trans-unit.source: title: What's New in Hyper-V for Windows 10
trans-unit.target: title: What's New in Hyper-V for Windows 10

trans-unit.source: What's New for Hyper-V on Windows 10
trans-unit.target: What's New for Hyper-V on Windows 10

trans-unit.source: 12-Nov update.
trans-unit.target: 12-Nov update.

trans-unit.source: This topic explains the new and changed functionality in Hyper-V on Windows 10®.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains the new and changed functionality in Hyper-V on Windows 10®.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Direct
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Direct

trans-unit.source: There is a now an easy and reliable way to run Windows PowerShell commands inside a virtual machine from the host operating system.
trans-unit.target: There is a now an easy and reliable way to run Windows PowerShell commands inside a virtual machine from the host operating system.

trans-unit.source: There are no network or firewall requirements or special configuration.
trans-unit.target: There are no network or firewall requirements or special configuration.

trans-unit.source: It works regardless of your remote management configuration.
trans-unit.target: It works regardless of your remote management configuration.

trans-unit.source: To use it, you must run Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview on the host and the virtual machine guest operating system.
trans-unit.target: To use it, you must run Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview on the host and the virtual machine guest operating system.

trans-unit.source: To create a PowerShell Direct session, use one of the following commands:
trans-unit.target: To create a PowerShell Direct session, use one of the following commands:

trans-unit.source: Today, Hyper-V administrators rely on two categories of tools for connecting to a virtual machine on their Hyper-V host:
trans-unit.target: Today, Hyper-V administrators rely on two categories of tools for connecting to a virtual machine on their Hyper-V host:

trans-unit.source: Remote management tools such as PowerShell or Remote Desktop
trans-unit.target: Remote management tools such as PowerShell or Remote Desktop

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Virtual Machine Connection (VM Connect)
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Virtual Machine Connection (VM Connect)

trans-unit.source: Both of these technologies work well, but each have trade-offs as your Hyper-V deployment grows.
trans-unit.target: Both of these technologies work well, but each have trade-offs as your Hyper-V deployment grows.

trans-unit.source: VMConnect is reliable, but it can be hard to automate.
trans-unit.target: VMConnect is reliable, but it can be hard to automate.

trans-unit.source: Remote PowerShell is powerful, but can be difficult to setup and maintain.
trans-unit.target: Remote PowerShell is powerful, but can be difficult to setup and maintain.

trans-unit.source: Windows PowerShell Direct provides a powerful scripting and automation experience with the simplicity of VMConnect.
trans-unit.target: Windows PowerShell Direct provides a powerful scripting and automation experience with the simplicity of VMConnect.

trans-unit.source: Because Windows PowerShell Direct runs between the host and virtual machine, there is no need for a network connection or to enable remote management.
trans-unit.target: Because Windows PowerShell Direct runs between the host and virtual machine, there is no need for a network connection or to enable remote management.

trans-unit.source: You do need guest credentials to log into the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You do need guest credentials to log into the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Requirements
trans-unit.target: Requirements

trans-unit.source: You must be connected to a Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview host with virtual machines that run Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview as guests.
trans-unit.target: You must be connected to a Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview host with virtual machines that run Windows 10 or Windows Server Technical Preview as guests.

trans-unit.source: You need to be logged in with Hyper-V Administrator credentials on the host.
trans-unit.target: You need to be logged in with Hyper-V Administrator credentials on the host.

trans-unit.source: You need User credentials for the virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: You need User credentials for the virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine you want to connect to must be running and booted.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine you want to connect to must be running and booted.

trans-unit.source: Hot add and remove for network adapters and memory
trans-unit.target: Hot add and remove for network adapters and memory

trans-unit.source: You can now add or remove a Network Adapter while the virtual machine is running, without downtime.
trans-unit.target: You can now add or remove a Network Adapter while the virtual machine is running, without downtime.

trans-unit.source: This works for generation 2 virtual machines running both Windows and Linux operating systems.
trans-unit.target: This works for generation 2 virtual machines running both Windows and Linux operating systems.

trans-unit.source: You can also adjust the amount of memory assigned to a virtual machine while it's running, even if you haven’t enabled Dynamic Memory.
trans-unit.target: You can also adjust the amount of memory assigned to a virtual machine while it's running, even if you haven’t enabled Dynamic Memory.

trans-unit.source: This works for both generation 1 and generation 2 virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: This works for both generation 1 and generation 2 virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Production checkpoints
trans-unit.target: Production checkpoints

trans-unit.source: Production checkpoints allow you to easily create “point in time” images of a virtual machine, which can be restored later on in a way that is completely supported for all production workloads.
trans-unit.target: Production checkpoints allow you to easily create “point in time” images of a virtual machine, which can be restored later on in a way that is completely supported for all production workloads.

trans-unit.source: This is achieved by using backup technology inside the guest to create the checkpoint, instead of using saved state technology.
trans-unit.target: This is achieved by using backup technology inside the guest to create the checkpoint, instead of using saved state technology.

trans-unit.source: For production checkpoints, the Volume Snapshot Service (VSS) is used inside Windows virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: For production checkpoints, the Volume Snapshot Service (VSS) is used inside Windows virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: Linux virtual machines flush their file system buffers to create a file system consistent checkpoint.
trans-unit.target: Linux virtual machines flush their file system buffers to create a file system consistent checkpoint.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create checkpoints using saved state technology, you can still choose to use standard checkpoints for your virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create checkpoints using saved state technology, you can still choose to use standard checkpoints for your virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: Important: The default for new virtual machines will be to create production checkpoints with a fallback to standard checkpoints.
trans-unit.target: Important: The default for new virtual machines will be to create production checkpoints with a fallback to standard checkpoints.

trans-unit.source: Hyper-V Manager improvements
trans-unit.target: Hyper-V Manager improvements

trans-unit.source: Alternate credentials support – You can now use a different set of credentials in Hyper-V manager when you connect to another Windows 10 Technical Preview remote host.
trans-unit.target: Alternate credentials support – You can now use a different set of credentials in Hyper-V manager when you connect to another Windows 10 Technical Preview remote host.

trans-unit.source: You can also save these credentials so it's easier to log on later.
trans-unit.target: You can also save these credentials so it's easier to log on later.

trans-unit.source: Down-level management - You can now use Hyper-V manager to manage more versions of Hyper-V.
trans-unit.target: Down-level management - You can now use Hyper-V manager to manage more versions of Hyper-V.

trans-unit.source: With Hyper-V manager in Windows 10 Technical Preview, you can manage computers running Hyper-V on Windows Server 2012, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: With Hyper-V manager in Windows 10 Technical Preview, you can manage computers running Hyper-V on Windows Server 2012, Windows 8, Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: Updated management protocol - Hyper-V manager has been updated to communicate with remote Hyper-V hosts using the WS-MAN protocol, which permits CredSSP, Kerberos or NTLM authentication.
trans-unit.target: Updated management protocol - Hyper-V manager has been updated to communicate with remote Hyper-V hosts using the WS-MAN protocol, which permits CredSSP, Kerberos or NTLM authentication.

trans-unit.source: When you use CredSSP to connect to a remote Hyper-V host, it allows you to perform a live migration without first enabling constrained delegation in Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: When you use CredSSP to connect to a remote Hyper-V host, it allows you to perform a live migration without first enabling constrained delegation in Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: WS-MAN-based infrastructure also simplifies the configuration necessary to enable a host for remote management.
trans-unit.target: WS-MAN-based infrastructure also simplifies the configuration necessary to enable a host for remote management.

trans-unit.source: WS-MAN connects over port 80, which is open by default.
trans-unit.target: WS-MAN connects over port 80, which is open by default.

trans-unit.source: Connected Standby works
trans-unit.target: Connected Standby works

trans-unit.source: When Hyper-V is enabled on a computer that uses the Always On/Always Connected (AOAC) power model, the Connected Standby power state is now available.
trans-unit.target: When Hyper-V is enabled on a computer that uses the Always On/Always Connected (AOAC) power model, the Connected Standby power state is now available.

trans-unit.source: In Windows 8 and 8.1, Hyper-V caused computers that used the Always On/Always Connected (AOAC) power model (also known as InstantON) to never sleep.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 8 and 8.1, Hyper-V caused computers that used the Always On/Always Connected (AOAC) power model (also known as InstantON) to never sleep.

trans-unit.source: See this [KB article](
trans-unit.target: See this [KB article](

trans-unit.source: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2973536) for a full discription.
trans-unit.target: https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/2973536) for a full discription.

trans-unit.source: Linux secure boot
trans-unit.target: Linux secure boot

trans-unit.source: More Linux operating systems, running on generation 2 virtual machines, can now boot with the secure boot option enabled.
trans-unit.target: More Linux operating systems, running on generation 2 virtual machines, can now boot with the secure boot option enabled.

trans-unit.source: Ubuntu 14.04 and later, and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12, are enabled for secure boot on hosts that run the Technical Preview.
trans-unit.target: Ubuntu 14.04 and later, and SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 12, are enabled for secure boot on hosts that run the Technical Preview.

trans-unit.source: Before you boot the virtual machine for the first time, you must specify that the virtual machine should use the Microsoft UEFI Certificate Authority.
trans-unit.target: Before you boot the virtual machine for the first time, you must specify that the virtual machine should use the Microsoft UEFI Certificate Authority.

trans-unit.source: At an elevated Windows Powershell prompt, type:
trans-unit.target: At an elevated Windows Powershell prompt, type:

trans-unit.source: For more information on running Linux virtual machines on Hyper-V, see <link><linkText>Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on running Linux virtual machines on Hyper-V, see <link><linkText>Linux and FreeBSD Virtual Machines on Hyper-V</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Virtual Machine Configuration Version
trans-unit.target: Virtual Machine Configuration Version

trans-unit.source: When you move or import a virtual machine to a host running Hyper-V on Windows 10 from host running Windows 8.1, the virtual machine’s configuration file isn't automatically upgraded.
trans-unit.target: When you move or import a virtual machine to a host running Hyper-V on Windows 10 from host running Windows 8.1, the virtual machine’s configuration file isn't automatically upgraded.

trans-unit.source: This allows the virtual machine to be moved back to a host running Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: This allows the virtual machine to be moved back to a host running Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: You won't have access to new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.
trans-unit.target: You won't have access to new virtual machine features until you manually update the virtual machine configuration version.

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine configuration version represents what version of Hyper-V the virtual machine’s configuration, saved state, and snapshot files it's compatible with.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine configuration version represents what version of Hyper-V the virtual machine’s configuration, saved state, and snapshot files it's compatible with.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines with configuration version 5 are compatible with Windows 8.1 and can run on both Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines with configuration version 5 are compatible with Windows 8.1 and can run on both Windows 8.1 and Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines with configuration version 6 are compatible with Windows 10 and won't run on Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines with configuration version 6 are compatible with Windows 10 and won't run on Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: How do I check the configuration version of the virtual machines running on Hyper-V?
trans-unit.target: How do I check the configuration version of the virtual machines running on Hyper-V?

trans-unit.source: From an elevated command prompt, run the following command:
trans-unit.target: From an elevated command prompt, run the following command:

trans-unit.source: How do I upgrade the configuration version of a virtual machine?
trans-unit.target: How do I upgrade the configuration version of a virtual machine?

trans-unit.source: From an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt, run one of the following commands:
trans-unit.target: From an elevated Windows PowerShell command prompt, run one of the following commands:

trans-unit.source: Or
trans-unit.target: Or

trans-unit.source: *Important: *
trans-unit.target: *Important: *

trans-unit.source: After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version, you can't move the virtual machine to a host that runs Windows 8.1.
trans-unit.target: After you upgrade the virtual machine configuration version, you can't move the virtual machine to a host that runs Windows 8.1.

trans-unit.source: You can't downgrade the virtual machine configuration version from version 6 to version 5.
trans-unit.target: You can't downgrade the virtual machine configuration version from version 6 to version 5.

trans-unit.source: You must turn off the virtual machine to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.
trans-unit.target: You must turn off the virtual machine to upgrade the virtual machine configuration.

trans-unit.source: After the upgrade, the virtual machine uses the new configuration file format.
trans-unit.target: After the upgrade, the virtual machine uses the new configuration file format.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see New virtual machine configuration file format.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see New virtual machine configuration file format.

trans-unit.source: New virtual machine configuration file format
trans-unit.target: New virtual machine configuration file format

trans-unit.source: Virtual machines now have a new configuration file format which is designed to increase the efficiency of reading and writing virtual machine configuration data.
trans-unit.target: Virtual machines now have a new configuration file format which is designed to increase the efficiency of reading and writing virtual machine configuration data.

trans-unit.source: It's also designed to reduce the potential for data corruption if there's a storage failure.
trans-unit.target: It's also designed to reduce the potential for data corruption if there's a storage failure.

trans-unit.source: The new configuration files use the .VMCX extension for virtual machine configuration data and the .VMRS extension for runtime state data.
trans-unit.target: The new configuration files use the .VMCX extension for virtual machine configuration data and the .VMRS extension for runtime state data.

trans-unit.source: Important: The .VMCX file is a binary format.
trans-unit.target: Important: The .VMCX file is a binary format.

trans-unit.source: Directly editing the .VMCX or .VMRS file isn't supported.
trans-unit.target: Directly editing the .VMCX or .VMRS file isn't supported.

trans-unit.source: Integration Services delivered through Windows Update
trans-unit.target: Integration Services delivered through Windows Update

trans-unit.source: Updates to integration services for Windows guests are now distributed through Windows Update.
trans-unit.target: Updates to integration services for Windows guests are now distributed through Windows Update.

trans-unit.source: Integration components (also called integration services) are the set of synthetic drivers which allow a virtual machine to communicate with the host operating system.
trans-unit.target: Integration components (also called integration services) are the set of synthetic drivers which allow a virtual machine to communicate with the host operating system.

trans-unit.source: They control services ranging from time sync to guest file copy.
trans-unit.target: They control services ranging from time sync to guest file copy.

trans-unit.source: We've been talking to customers about integration component installation and update over the past year to discover that they are a huge pain point during the upgrade process.
trans-unit.target: We've been talking to customers about integration component installation and update over the past year to discover that they are a huge pain point during the upgrade process.

trans-unit.source: Historically, all new versions of Hyper-V came with new integration components.
trans-unit.target: Historically, all new versions of Hyper-V came with new integration components.

trans-unit.source: Upgrading the Hyper-V host required upgrading the integration components in the virtual machines as well.
trans-unit.target: Upgrading the Hyper-V host required upgrading the integration components in the virtual machines as well.

trans-unit.source: The new integration components were included with the Hyper-V host then they were installed in the virtual machines using vmguest.iso.
trans-unit.target: The new integration components were included with the Hyper-V host then they were installed in the virtual machines using vmguest.iso.

trans-unit.source: This process required restarting the virtual machine and couldn't be batched with other Windows updates.
trans-unit.target: This process required restarting the virtual machine and couldn't be batched with other Windows updates.

trans-unit.source: Since the Hyper-V administrator had to offer vmguest.iso and the virtual machine administrator had to install them, integration component upgrade required the Hyper-V administrator have administrator credentials in the virtual machines -- which isn't always the case.
trans-unit.target: Since the Hyper-V administrator had to offer vmguest.iso and the virtual machine administrator had to install them, integration component upgrade required the Hyper-V administrator have administrator credentials in the virtual machines -- which isn't always the case.

trans-unit.source: In Windows 10 and going forward, all integration components will be delivered to virtual machined through Windows Update along with other important updates.
trans-unit.target: In Windows 10 and going forward, all integration components will be delivered to virtual machined through Windows Update along with other important updates.

trans-unit.source: There are updates available today for virtual machines running:
trans-unit.target: There are updates available today for virtual machines running:

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2012
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2012

trans-unit.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
trans-unit.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

trans-unit.source: Windows 8
trans-unit.target: Windows 8

trans-unit.source: Windows 7
trans-unit.target: Windows 7

trans-unit.source: The virtual machine must be connected to Windows Update or a WSUS server.
trans-unit.target: The virtual machine must be connected to Windows Update or a WSUS server.

trans-unit.source: In the future, integration component updates will have a category ID, for this release, they are listed as KBs.
trans-unit.target: In the future, integration component updates will have a category ID, for this release, they are listed as KBs.

trans-unit.source: To read more about how we determine applicability, see this <link><linkText>blog post</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: To read more about how we determine applicability, see this <link><linkText>blog post</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>this blog</linkText><title></title></link> post for a detailed walkthrough of installing integration services.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>this blog</linkText><title></title></link> post for a detailed walkthrough of installing integration services.

trans-unit.source: Important: The ISO image file vmguest.iso is no longer needed for updating integration components.
trans-unit.target: Important: The ISO image file vmguest.iso is no longer needed for updating integration components.

trans-unit.source: It's not included with Hyper-V on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: It's not included with Hyper-V on Windows 10.
